intro: Monticalia guadalupe subsp. guadalupe, commonly known as Guadalupe monticalia, is a rare shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, followed by small, three-lobed berries.
